main event: A radio officer observed 15 flying saucers passing over Hong Kong in arciform formation on 13 September 1952.
interesting points: The saucers were fluorescent and illuminated the clouds they passed., The objects were reported to be three times the size of a star., The radio officer withheld his identity and intended to report to the Royal Observatory later., This sighting marks the first reported instance of flying saucers in Hong Kong., The weather conditions at the time were overcast with light rain.
witness description: a radio officer with a hobby in electronics
